title: The Missing Ration Cards
description: A market vendor in Block D reported four ration cards missing after closing. The last two customers — a factory worker and his co-worker — were both detained. One of them must know where the cards are.
stateChoice: Convict Dejan Markovic for exceeding his caloric allocation.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: You were one of the last two customers at the market. What did you buy?

responseSequence: My weekly rations. Same as always.
Bread, oil, dried beans. Nothing out of the ordinary.
The records are... look, sometimes the vendor writes things down wrong.
I only bought what my family needs.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Four ration cards went missing from the vendor's counter. Do you know anything about that?

responseSequence: Missing cards? No.
I paid with my own card and left. Ask the vendor — he probably miscounted.
Look, the allocation for a family of three is not enough. My boy is eight. He's always hungry.

clickableClues.clickableText: the allocation for a family of three is not enough
clickableClues.noteText: <person>Dejan Markovic</person> admits the standard ration allocation is not enough for his family and implies he took extra cards

responseSequence: Fine! I took them. Four cards.
My son goes to bed hungry three nights a week. You want me to just watch that?

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Your purchase records show 4,200 calories per day this week. Your family allocation is 2,800. How do you explain the difference?

responseSequence: That can't be right. There must be an error in the records.
I buy what my card allows. Nothing more.
Alright. I used extra cards.
I took them from the counter when the vendor wasn't looking. I needed more food for my family.

clickableClues.noteText: <person>Dejan</person> confessed to taking ration cards from the <location>market vendor's counter</location> when the vendor was not looking

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Your co-worker Stefan's purchases are within his allocation. Why are yours so much higher?

responseSequence: Stefan lives alone. I have a wife and a growing child.
The system gives single men and families almost the same. Does that seem fair to you?

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: You've admitted the allocation isn't enough. Did you take the cards to make up the difference?

responseSequence: Yes. I took four cards over the past month.
I used them at different vendors so nobody would notice. This week I got careless.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Stefan says you always seem to have more food at lunch than he does. True?

responseSequence: Stefan talks too much.
My wife packs my lunch. That's all.

lawyeredUpResponses: I said what I said. That's enough.
My family needed food. That's my answer for everything.
rattledResponses: Please... my son is only eight.
What happens to my family if you send me away?
I just wanted to feed my boy.
shutdownResponses: Do what you have to do.
I have nothing more to say.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: You and Dejan were the last customers at the market. What happened?

responseSequence: We went after our shift like we always do.
Dejan went to the counter first. I was behind him. We bought our rations and left.

clickableClues.clickableText: Dejan went to the counter first
clickableClues.noteText: <person>Stefan Jovic</person> confirms <person>Dejan</person> was at the vendor counter before him and had more time near the cards

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Four ration cards went missing. Did you see Dejan take anything from the counter?

responseSequence: I wasn't really watching. I was checking my own list.
He was at the counter a bit longer than usual. But I didn't think anything of it.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Dejan's purchase records show he's been buying far more than his allocation. Did you know about this?

responseSequence: No. I mean, he always seems to have more food at lunch than I do.
I figured his wife was a good cook. I didn't ask.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Your records show you buy within your allocation. Always?

responseSequence: Always. I live alone. My allocation is enough for one person.
I don't have a family to worry about. Dejan does.

tagInteractions.tagQuestion: Dejan has admitted to taking the cards. Did you help him?

responseSequence: No. I had no idea.
Dejan is my friend. We eat lunch together. That's it. I didn't know he was taking extra cards.

lawyeredUpResponses: I've told you everything I know.
I didn't do anything wrong. Can I go?
Please check my records. They'll show I'm telling the truth.
rattledResponses: I don't understand why I'm here. I paid for my rations.
Am I going to be charged? I haven't done anything.
Can someone tell my supervisor? I'll miss my shift.

Discover the calorie discrepancy in the ration records
